citations.narrative:
* An estimated four inch by twelve inch of plastic covered insulation board was missing, exposing the interior insulation.
In addition, an estimated one ft. by two ft. area of missing fiberglass wall board was observed exposing a chewed,
roughened surface. Four dog's come into contact with the affected surfaces located in sheltered housing. The affected
surface area cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized on a regular basis. A chewed, roughened surface could harbor
disease causing agents which affects the health and well-being of the dogs. The open area between the fiberglass and
wood wall could serve as a collection area for dirt, hair, fecal waste or other debris. All surface of housing facilities must
be maintained on a regular basis. The licensee must ensure all surfaces are always maintained on a regular basis at all
times or be replaced when worn that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized. Correct by 4/14/23.

* There is a mixture of dirt, grease and other excreta accumulating on the interior wood enclosure panels in two
enclosures. Four dogs are in contact with the affected surfaces located in sheltered housing. The affected area covers
approximately 30 to 50 percent of the exterior wall area. Cleaning of surfaces is necessary to prevent an accumulation of
excreta and other disease hazards. This indicates an unsanitary living condition exists that could lead to potential disease
or health risks. Surfaces which are not cleaned and sanitized properly increase the risk of disease hazards for the dogs.
Cleanliness is important to the health and well-being of the animals. All surfaces of housing facilities must be cleaned and
sanitized when necessary to satisfy generally accepted husbandry standards and practices. The licensee must ensure
that hard surfaces with which the dogs come in contact must be spot cleaned daily and sanitized in accordance with 3.11
(B) of this sub part to prevent accumulation of excreta and reduce disease hazards. Correct by 4/4/23.

* There is a mixture of water, bedding and animal waste collecting on the outside attached runs to sheltered housing.
Ten dogs are in contact with the affected area. It creates potential unsanitary conditions and could lead to potential
disease, contamination, or health risks. Cleaning of the ground floor area must be maintained to minimize fecal and urine
contamination, vermin and pest infestation, insects, odors, and other disease hazards. Odors, insects, disease hazards,
and pest infestation from fecal and organic material accumulations can have an adverse effect on the health and well-
being of the animals at this facility. The licensee must provide for regular and frequent removal of water and other fluids
in a manner that minimizes contamination and disease risks. Correct by 4/7/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
